Symptom: Do you find it hard to explain how you're feeling — even to people close to you?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like there’s emotion in your body, but no language for it?

Symptom: Do you frequently overthink your own behavior — even after the moment has passed?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like you relive how you said something, analyzing every word?

Symptom: Do you sometimes feel like you’re performing a version of yourself that others expect?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like you wear a personality that fits the room, even if it’s not yours?

Symptom: Do you find your emotions feel delayed — like you only process things hours or days later?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like it doesn’t hit you in the moment, but floods in later?

Symptom: Do you often interrupt people — even when you don’t mean to?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your thoughts feel urgent and slip out before you can stop them?

Symptom: Do you find yourself doing or saying things just to avoid silence?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like filling the quiet is easier than sitting in it?

Symptom: Do you tend to keep your struggles hidden until they boil over?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like you bottle it all up until it bursts?

Symptom: Do you find yourself zoning out when someone is talking — even if you care about what they’re saying?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your brain just floats off mid-conversation?

Symptom: Do you feel panicky or uneasy when things are ‘too quiet’ or calm for too long?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like silence makes your brain invent something to worry about?

Symptom: Do you sometimes get the urge to escape your environment suddenly — even if nothing obvious triggered it?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your body says ‘get out’ before your brain knows why?
